I made some tests for these. Unfortunately the two fully qualified name checks don't work :(

This builds successfully on g++ 5.4.0, but I was expecting it to fail.

#include <type_traits>

namespace ns
{
  class SomeClass
  {
    float test;
  };
}

using ns::SomeClass;

static_assert(std::is_same<SomeClass, ::SomeClass>::value, "Fully qualified name check");

I want to file a bug with GCC to see if this is expected, but their bug tracker account creation seems to be down.

content.raw:
I know this CMake code is copy pasted from Gazebo, but I thinks it is worth anyhow to note something:

* On *nix systems, CMake provides the [`CMAKE_DL_LIBS`](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/variable/CMAKE_DL_LIBS.html) variable that contains the library to link to provide the functions provided in the `dlfcn.h` header. The `dlfcn.h` header is contained in the system include directories and so does not need to be found. `CMAKE_DL_LIBS` is tipically `dl` on Linux and macOs , but can be empty on several *BSDs or even `ld` on some strange Unix platforms. 

* On Windows, the latest version of dlfcn-win32 [1] comes with full support for relocatable CMake targets, and so it can be used by simply by:
~~~
if(WIN32)
  find_package(dlfcn-win32 REQUIRED)
  set(CMAKE_DL_LIBS dlfcn-win32::dl)
endif()
~~~
However, this depends on version of `dlfcn-win32` will be referenced in the `configure.bat` build script.

[1] : https://github.com/dlfcn-win32/dlfcn-win32/releases/tag/v1.1.0
content.html:
I know this CMake code is copy pasted from Gazebo, but I thinks it is worth anyhow to note something:

  • On nix systems, CMake provides the CMAKE_DL_LIBS variable that contains the library to link to provide the functions provided in the dlfcn.h header. The dlfcn.h header is contained in the system include directories and so does not need to be found. CMAKE_DL_LIBS is tipically dl on Linux and macOs , but can be empty on several BSDs or even ld on some strange Unix platforms.

  • On Windows, the latest version of dlfcn-win32 [1] comes with full support for relocatable CMake targets, and so it can be used by simply by:

if(WIN32)
  find_package(dlfcn-win32 REQUIRED)
  set(CMAKE_DL_LIBS dlfcn-win32::dl)
endif()

However, this depends on version of dlfcn-win32 will be referenced in the configure.bat build script.

[1] : https://github.com/dlfcn-win32/dlfcn-win32/releases/tag/v1.1.0

content.raw: I noticed it isn't possible to build this plugin by itself. I don't think it's necessary for this PR, but we could keep in mind to add an example of a plugin which is its own cmake project later, as a reference for users. For example, Gazebo has an [examples/plugins](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/4e250e782cf04f70d2db6ad885a59bf6186691af/examples/plugins/?at=default) directory where each plugin can be built individually.
